page.title: 16Local May Day.
page.content: The first mention of May Day Celebrations in the School Log is in 1887 but it does not say what they were.The children had a holiday on this day.The first May Day was in 1906.It was not organised by the school but by a committee of ladies who used it to raise money for the Chapel's Sunday School treat. The children walked around Ringstead,Thrapston and the Addingtons stopping at times to dance around the May Pole.They had no instruments so the younger children sang Come Lasses And Lads,to help them to dance in time.Many of the older people have told us about these festivities.The first mention of May Day being held at school was in 1929. The May Queen was crowned in the play- ground.After the war May Day restarted in 1953 and has gone on ever since.
